title: Strictly’s Craig Revel Horwood apologises to Anton Du Beke after ‘fake teeth’ gaffe
text:
Craig thought Anton Du Beke had fake teeth in (Picture: BBC)

Craig Revel Horwood left the Strictly judges in hysterics are believing Anton Du Beke was wearing fake teeth throughout the routine.

Anton and Strictly partner Emma Barton danced the Salsa to Soul Bossa Nova by Quincy Jones from Austin Powers for Movie Week, with the former dressing up in an outfit to match.

When it came to critique their dance, Craig was so convinced on the outfit he even believed Anton’s teeth were fake to match his wig.

‘I was slightly distracted with the wig and the fake teeth that you have in,’ Craig said.

Craig thinking Anton’s teeth are fake is the funniest thing to ever happen on this show #Strictly #strictly2019 pic.twitter.com/PnudJwStTu — amy 📍 pinned (@fumerosbeatz) October 5, 2019

‘I did think you underdanced it slightly, by that I mean you can come out and really slam it, you’ve got all the potential in the world to do that and I actually loved that routine.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

As the judges and host Tess Daly were left laughing at the comment, Anton clarified: ‘They’re not fake they’re all my own my dear.’

Tess added: ‘They are your own teeth, let’s just clarify that.’

It took a while for Craig to clock on the teeth weren’t fake, prompting even more hysterics from the judges.

Craig Revel Horwood left the judges in bits (Picture: BBC)

Craig, slightly perplexed, said: ‘They’re not fake? I’m sorry Anton. It must have been the glasses and the wig and everything.’

Taking it all in good spirits, Anton replied: ‘Darling this is going to cost you a nine.’

Unfortunately, Craig awarded the pair a six, while the rest of the judges Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli gave them sevens each for a total of 27.

Speaking about the comment afterwards, Anton said: ‘I was about to say I’ve never been so offended but that wouldn’t be true darling, I’ll be honest with you.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday BBC One at 7.15pm.
